misc-redundant-expression.description:
Description

Detect redundant expressions which are typically errors due to copy-paste.

Depending on the operator expressions may be

redundant,
always
true
,
always
false
,
always a constant (zero or one).

Examples:

((
x
+
1
)
|
(
x
+
1
))
// (x+1) is redundant
(
p
->
x
==
p
->
x
)
// always true
(
p
->
x
<
p
->
x
)
// always false
(
speed
-
speed
+
1
==
12
)
// speed - speed is always zero
int
b
=
a
|
4
|
a
// identical expr on both sides
((
x
=
1
)
|
(
x
=
1
))
// expression is identical
(
DEFINE_1
|
DEFINE_1
)
// same macro on the both sides
((
DEF_1
+
DEF_2
)
|
(
DEF_1
+
DEF_2
))
// expressions differ in spaces only

Floats are handled except in the case that NaNs are checked like so:

int
TestFloat
(
float
F
)
{
if
(
F
==
F
)
// Identical float values used
return
1
;
return
0
;
}
int
TestFloat
(
float
F
)
{
// Testing NaN.
if
(
F
!=
F
&&
F
==
F
)
// does not warn
return
1
;
return
0
;
}
misc-redundant-expression.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
